business.headline: Shankh Air ready for takeoff: All you need to know about India's new airlineShankh Air, owned by Shankh Aviation Private Limited, has been granted a No Objection Certificate (NOC) by the ministry, valid for three years.

Sensex crosses 85,000, Nifty hits 26,000: Will bull run continue on D-Street? While Sensex and Nifty closed below record highs amid volatility, analysts remain cautiously optimistic, noting that Indian equities have defied global uncertainty to post strong gains this year.

Sensex, Nifty dip after hitting record highs; Tata Steel jumps 4%The Sensex settled 14.57 points lower at 84,929.25 after crossing 85,000 for the first time, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 1.35 points higher at 25,940.40 after crossing 26,000.

NPS Vatsalya: Is it the right choice for parents?Unlike other financial products aimed at short-term goals like education or marriage, NPS Vatsalya focusses solely on long-term retirement savings for the child.

Western Carriers shares list at 1% discount. Should you hold or sell? Western Carriers market listing: The company's stock opened at Rs 170 on the BSE, which is 1.16% below its issue price of Rs 172. On the NSE, the shares listed at Rs 171, down by Rs 1, or 0.6%.

Explained: Why Exxaro Tiles shares jumped over 18% todayThe company stock price rose as much as 18.4% to Rs 94.96 in early trade. At 2 pm, shares of Exxaro Tiles were trading 17.24% higher at Rs 94.25.

Northern Arc Capital shares list at 33% premium over IPO price. Hold or sell?Northern Arc Capital IPO listing: The stock opened at Rs 351 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, up 33.5% from its issue price of Rs 263. Similarly, it listed at Rs 350 on the National Stock Exchange.

Arkade Developers shares gain 37% on listing: Should you book profit or hold?Arkade Developers stock opened at Rs 175 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, a 36.72% jump from its issue price of Rs 128. On the National Stock Exchange, the shares listed at Rs 175.90, reflecting a similar premium of 37.42%.

Paytm shares jump over 3% after Emkay's rating upgrade. More upside ahead?Paytm share price: The rally comes after Emkay Global Financial Services upgraded its rating on One97 Communications from 'Reduce' to 'Add' while doubling its target price to Rs 750 per share from the previous Rs 375.

Byju's faces setback as US court upholds $1.2 billion loan default rulingThe court's decision supports an earlier ruling made by the Delaware Court of Chancery, which allowed the company's lenders, represented by Glas Trust LLC, to seize control of Byju's Alpha Inc

JSW Group to shift Rs 40,000 crore EV project from Odisha to Maharashtra: ReportJSW Group, led by Sajjan Jindal, is now eyeing Maharashtra, with Aurangabad and Nagpur emerging as the top contenders for the large-scale EV and battery project.
Manaba Finance IPO Day 2: Check latest subscription, expected listing gains The IPO of Manba Finnace is a fresh issue of 1.26 crore shares and closes for subscription on September 25, 2024.

Vodafone Idea shares fall 2% as ICICI Securities cuts target price ICICI Securities has reduced Vodafone Idea's EV/EBITDA multiple to 13 times FY27 from 14 times and lowered its target price to Rs 11 from Rs 15.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: Can It supercharge NTPC's stock growth?NTPC's performance in the last two years has largely been driven by its growing renewable energy (RE) business, which is expected to go public in the first half of FY2025.

Gold, silver price today, September 24, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today September 24, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Tuesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Arkade Developers shares make strong D-Street debut, lists at 37% premiumArkade Developers listing: Shares of the real estate company listed at Rs 175 on the Bombay Exchange (BSE) at a premium of 36.72% over its issue price of Rs 128.

Western Carriers makes weak D-Street debut, lists at 1% discountWestern Carriers market listing: Despite the weak listing, the IPO received strong investor interest, being oversubscribed nearly 31 times, primarily driven by non-institutional investors.

Northern Arc Capital shares list at 33% premium, misses GMP Northern Arc Capital listing: The shares opened at Rs 351, with a premium of 33.5% over the IPO price of Rs 263 per share on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Sensex crosses 85,000 for 1st time, Nifty hits record highAs of 10:05 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex had risen 80.74 points to 85,009.35, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 29.15 points to 25,968.20.

Sensex, Nifty slip from record highs amid rising Middle East tensionsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 107.07 points to 84,821.54 at around 9:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 23.50 points to trade at 25,915.55.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Exclusive: Vinesh Phogat says entering politics not a choice, but a necessityIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Vinesh Phogat spoke in detail about her decision to enter politics, about why she chose to contest on Congress ticket, and what is her vision for Haryana.

EY India office whose employee died lacked labour welfare permit: SourcesAccording to sources, the EY India unit, which has been running since 2007 in Pune, does not have a Shop Act licence, which regulates work conditions, including employee rights, working hours, wages, and safety.
Joe Biden meets Muhammad Yunus, offers US's full support to BangladeshAccording to a press note, Joe Biden said if the students could sacrifice so much for their country, "they too should do more".

BJP distances itself from Kangana Ranaut's 'bring back 3 farm laws' remarkWhile distancing from Kangana Ranaut's comments, BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said that the Mandi MP had not been authorised to speak on behalf of the party on the three farm laws.

Watch: Lebanese journalist's home hit by Israeli missile during live interviewIn a video which went viral on social media, Fadi Boudaya is seen speaking during the live interview as a missile hits his home, throwing him off the screen.

Watch: Pet dog fights off cobra to protect children in Uttar Pradesh's JhansiA pit bull fought off a venomous cobra and saved the lives of children playing in the garden in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi. The video of the dog's brave actions has gone viral on social media. The snake had entered the garden while the children were playing outside. Upon hearing the children's screams, the pit bull, named Genie, broke free from its leash and attacked the cobra. The dog bit the snake and repeatedly slammed it to the ground, eventually killing it.

Pawan Kalyan vs Prakash Raj over Tirupati laddu row: 'Attack on Sanatana Dharma'Pawan Kalyan has called the adulteration in Tirupati laddus an attack on Sanatana Dharma. He questioned actor Prakash Raj after the latter criticised his statement.

Badlapur accused was aggressive, fired thrice: Cop who shot him in 'self-defence'In an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Inspector Sanjay Shinde said that Akshay Shinde, who was accused of sexually abusing two girls in Badlapur, became aggressive while he was being transported from Taloja jail to Thane and fired three rounds. Akshay Shinde was then killed in a police encounter.

Lebanon: How Switzerland of Middle East became modern-day nightmareBefore it was known for Hezbollah rockets and devastation, Lebanon, especially its capital Beirut, was the playground of the world's most affluent tourists. This is how Lebanon, the Switzerland of the Middle East, turned into a modern-day dystopian state. But when the bomb stops, the party begins in Beirut.

Why was Siddaramaiah's plea in MUDA case rejected? Here's what court saidThe Karnataka High Court rejected Siddaramaiah's petition challenging the legality of the Governor's nod to an investigation against him over the alleged MUDA land scam.

This fraud must end now: Supreme Court rejects Punjab's plea linked to NRI quotaThe Punjab government had challenged a High Court order, which trashed its August 20 notification extending the ambit of the NRI quota to include distant relatives "such as uncles, aunts, grandparents, and cousins" for admissions in medical colleges.

IAS aspirant finds spy cameras in her room in Delhi, landlord's son arrestedThe accused had hidden cameras in bulb holders in the bathroom and bedroom. The police arrested the accused and retrieved the laptop containing the videos.

How illegal streaming apps could land you in jail, your info on dark webRaided by cops for watching a film or a TV show? This is true, people might get raided for watching content on illegal platforms. IPTV apps and set-top boxes are giving access illegally to streaming platforms. However, using such apps might lead to legal action and personal information landing on the dark web.

Prevent beggars from entering under Umrah visas, Saudi Arabia urges PakSaudi Arabia has raised concerns about the growing number of Pakistani beggars arriving in the Kingdom under the guise of religious pilgrimage and asked Islamabad to take action to prevent them from entering the Gulf country, a media report said.

iPhone 16 Plus is the most sensible iPhone for most people this yearLike every year there are four new iPhones in 2024. And like every year, the Plus model, which in this case is the iPhone 16 Plus, is the best iPhone for most people in India. It has all the functionality most people need at relatively lower prices.

Actor Karthi apologises after Pawan Kalyan blasts him for comment on Tirupati ladduThe Tirupati laddu controversy has escalated, drawing in notable figures from both the film industry and politics. Actor Karthi's remark on this sensitive issue sparked a strong reaction from Pawan Kalyan, prompting the Paruthiveeran actor to apologise to the Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister.

Raja Ramanna, the nuclear physicist who said 'no' to Saddam HusseinPhysicist Raja Ramanna, who passed away on September 24, 2004, played a pivotal role in India's nuclear journey. Known for his integrity, he once refused Saddam Hussein's offer to lead Iraq's nuclear programme.

No one called me: Vinesh Phogat claims lack of support in OlympicsWrestler Vinesh Phogat said that she lacked support when she took part in the Paris Olympics where she was disqualified from her 50kg final bout.
Opinion: As Israel strikes Lebanon, can Iran sit it out?While the situation has been escalating in the Gaza war, all eyes have been on Iran, waiting to see how it responds.

Delhi teen stabbed to death for refusing to throw party over new phoneThe teenager, who was returning home after buying a new phone, was stabbed by his friend after he refused to throw a celebratory party.

How Shivaji's Surat raids threatened Aurangzeb and European powersHistorians regard Shivaji's two Surat raids as masterful strategic strikes against Mughal dominance, demonstrating his military genius. Following these audacious attacks, the French began to refer to him as "the holy Shivaji," a testament to the profound impact of his actions on his enemies.

Israel military says it killed Hezbollah commander in Beirut airstrikeIbrahim Muhammad Qabisi, the commander of Hezbollah's missiles and rockets force, was struck alongside additional central commanders of Hezbollah's missiles and rockets force, the Israeli military said in a statement.

Odisha custodial assault case sparks Army vs police social media spatThe woman has alleged that she was sexually assaulted at an Odisha police station, while her fiancée, an Army officer, was illegally locked up in a cell by the police.

What is the MUDA land scam in which Siddaramaiah will face probeThe case presents the first major challenge for Siddaramaiah, who has rarely faced allegations of corruption, in his second term as Karnataka Chief Minister.

Bengal cine workers urge Mamata Banerjee to form harassment probe committeeThe Women's Forum for Screen Workers has appealed to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee to form an independent committee to investigate workplace harassment and gender-based violence in the screen entertainment industry.

Kareena congratulates Laapataa Ladies team: Great stories deserve recognitionBollywood star Kareena Kapoor is celebrating Kiran Rao's directorial, Laapataa Ladies' selection for the Oscar race. The actor shared a note on social media about the same.

Sector 36's Deepak Dobriyal: I never ask for validation, struggle phase is overIn an exclusive interview with us, Deepak Dobriyal talked about being labelled as an 'underrated' actor. He described his state of mind while working on a gory film like Sector 36, and expressed his happiness at finally being in a position where he can make his own choices at work.

How Alia Bhatt sailed through her pregnancy while performing action sequencesAfter giving birth to her daughter Raha, Alia Bhatt went through a significant transformation. Her trainer Anshuka Parwani shared exclusive insights into the actor's workout routine and postpartum weight-loss journey with India Today Digital.

sports.headline: Harry Brook's maiden ODI hundred keeps England afloat in ODI series  ENG vs AUS: Harry Brook scored 110 runs off 94 balls as England made it 1-2 in the series with a 46-run win over Australia at the Riverside Ground in Chester-Le-Street.

Pakistan name squad for 1st Test vs England, Noman replaces ShahzadPAK vs ENG: Left-arm spinner Noman Ali has replaced injured fast bowler Khurram Shahzad as Pakistan named a 15-member squad for the opening Test against England.

La Liga President reveals Barcelona are clear to sign Ter Stegen's replacementLa Liga President Javier Tebas confirmed that FC Barcelona can sign a replacement for injured goalkeeper Marc-Andre ter Stegen outside the transfer window, provided they adhere to financial fair play rules, leaving the club with a crucial decision.

Sachin wishes son Arjun on birthday: 'Your love for life inspires me'Sachin Tendulkar penned a heartfelt message for son Arjun on his 25th birthday, praising his dedication to cricket and life. Despite setbacks, Arjun's resilience continues to inspire, following his best-ever first-class bowling performance for Goa.

Arjun Tendulkar turns 25: Sara sends heartfelt wishes for her brotherSachin Tendulkar's daughter Sara extended her birthday wishes to brother Arjun via an Instagram post. Arjun turned 25 on September 24, Tuesday.

Watch: Hasnain dismisses Rizwan for 0 in fiery spell in Champions Cup Pakistan Champions Cup: Mohammad Hasnain picked up three wickets in his opening spell as the Panthers bowled Markhors out for 137 in 36 overs in the Qualifier.

Inspired by younger self, Harmanpreet looks to thrive under pressureWomen's T20 World Cup: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur said that she wants to play with full freedom as she gets set to step for her ninth edition in the tournament.

Jurel, Dayal named in Irani Cup squad subject to Kanpur Test participationIrani Cup 2024: Wicketkeeper-batter Dhruv Jurel and fast bowler Yash Dayal were named in the Rest of India, but their availability will be subject to their participation in the second Test against Bangladesh. The Irani Cup between Mumbai and Rest of India will be played in Lucknow from October 1-5.

T20 World Cup 2024: Harmanpreet Kaur confident of overcoming Australia threat Harmanpreet Kaur is confident of the Indian team overcoming the Australia threat in the upcoming T20 World Cup 2024. India lost the tournament's final in 2020 and semi-final in 2023 to Australia.

India-origin Hasrat joins Melbourne Stars for WBBL 2024 WBBL 2024: India-born Hasrat Gill has joined Deepti Sharma and Yastika Bhatia in the Melbourne Stars. Gill recently earned her maiden contract for Victoria ahead of the 2024-25 season.

After Chess Olympiad heroics, D Gukesh receives a hero's welcome upon arrivalChess Olympiad 2024: Grandmaster D Gukesh received a hero's welcome upon his arrival in Chennai. Gukesh played a key role in India's first-ever gold in the open section in Budapest.

Messi, Rohit and chess stars: Pragg suggested iconic celebration, says Vaishali Chess Olympiad 2024: Grandmaster R Vaishali said she enjoyed watching D Gukesh and Tania Sachdev perform the iconic trophy-walk celebration during the presentation ceremony in Budapest on Sunday. t

Three Delhi boys in Kanpur: Kohli, Gambhir and Pant arrive for 2nd Test vs BANThe Indian team has arrived in Kanpur from Chennai to play the 2nd Test vs Bangladesh, starting September 27. Three Delhi boys namely Virat Kohli, Gautam Gambhir and Rishabh Pant were spotted at the airport.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
